instruction: What metric was chosen and how far can this metric go in detecting and grading prostate cancer (PCa) in real-time?

Sensitivity refers to the ability of the test to correctly identify patients with clinically significant prostate cancer, while specificity refers to the ability of the test to correctly identify patients without clinically significant prostate cancer.

According to the findings of the study, the RS probe and classification methods achieved a sensitivity of 90% in detecting clinically significant prostate cancer. This means that the test correctly identified 90% of patients who had prostate cancer. The specificity achieved was 80.2%, indicating that the test correctly identified 80.2% of patients who did not have clinically significant prostate cancer.

In terms of grading prostate cancer, the RS probe and classification methods demonstrated a sensitivity of 90% in differentiating between different cancer grades.
